hints.content: $20$ can be separated into two parts:  $\red{11}$ and $\green?$

We can use subtraction to find the missing part: $20 - \red{11} = \green9$

We can also think about how much more can be added to $\red{11}$ to get $20$: $\red{11} + \green9 = 20$

![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/849587ba7be304f81e8aeef7856337a6.png)

question.content:
There were $20$ cars in the parking lot. $11$ of the cars were red, and the rest were green. 



**Complete the number sentences to find how many cars were green.**

$20$ cars total $- \,11$ red cars $= $ [[☃ input-number 2]] green cars

$11$ red cars $ + $  [[☃ input-number 1]] green cars $ = 20$ cars total
